snippet.title: Hot auction market in Coburg as homes sell above reserve prices - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:
, sold for $1.14 million.
A RENOVATED california bungalow in Coburg has sold under the hammer for $1.14 million. The three-bedroom house at drew big numbers to open for inspections and its Saturday auction went on to eclipse the suburb's median house price of $900,000, according to CoreLogic. Also attracting keen competition in Coburg was a modern three-bedroom house at , that was snapped up by a buyer from Queensland for $1,050,500. Realestate.com.au ranks Coburg as a high-demand area, with properties listed on the website enjoying an average of 1016 visits, compared with the Victorian average of 733. We shone a spotlight on the suburb's auction market this weekend. 41 DARLINGTON GROVE, COBURG
41 Darlington Grove features a new kitchen.
Described by Nelson Alexander, Coburg, auctioneer Nuno Raimundo as a "little cracker", the California bungalow sold under the hammer $1.14 million, against a reserve $1.050 million. Four bidders vied for the property, with the successful bidder buying it on behalf of his daughter who is relocating to Melbourne from Sydney. Mr Raimundo said the move-in ready home with a new kitchen was in a tightly held pocket in an up and coming suburb near amenities. He described Coburg as an evolving suburb and a hot market that was attracting young families. 6 LYNN ST, COBURG
sold to a buyer from Queensland.
Five bidders competed for the three-bedroom house in front a crowd of 70 people. After an opening bid of $800,000, it sold under the hammer for $1,050,500, $150,500 more than the reserve. Brad Teal, Coburg, auctioneer Greg Kofoed said a local resident bought the property on behalf of her son from Queensland who plans to rent it out. SPOTLIGHT ON COBURG Reported auction sales this year: 115 Reported private sales this year: 62 Top reported price this year: $2.5m for 35 The Grove Demand: high, 1016 visits per property on realestate.com.au compared with the Victorian average of 733 SUBURB PROFILE:
